title: Understanding Relative Frequency
text: Relative frequency is the ratio of the frequency of a particular value to the total number of data points. It helps us understand how common a particular value is compared to the entire dataset.

title: Calculate Relative Frequencies
text: To determine the relative frequency, divide the number of people commuting a specific distance by the total number of people surveyed. Compare these values for $$10$$ miles and $$3$$ miles.

title: Compute Relative Frequency for $$10$$ Miles
text: If $$15$$ people commute $$10$$ miles and there are $$100$$ people surveyed, what is the relative frequency?

title: Compute Relative Frequency for $$3$$ Miles
text: If $$5$$ people commute $$3$$ miles and there are $$100$$ people surveyed, what is the relative frequency?

title: Compare the Relative Frequencies
text: Compare the relative frequencies calculated for $$10$$ miles and $$3$$ miles to determine which is greater.
